title: Clients do not receive error response in case of an exception when using default gRPC API with `@Blocking` or `@RunOnVirtualThread`

labels.name: area/virtual-threads
labels.description: Issue related to Java's Virtual Threads

body:
### Describe the bug

Clients do not receive error response (they just hang waiting for a response that never arrives) in case of an exception when using default gRPC API with `@Blocking` or `@RunOnVirtualThread`.

Please note this bug is not seen with Mutiny gRPC API. Also, this works as expected with default gRPC API when `@Blocking` or `@RunOnVirtualThread` is not used.

|                                              | Mutiny gRPC API                      | Default gRPC API                     |
| -------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------ | ------------------------------------ |
| Without `@Blocking` or `@RunOnVirtualThread` | *(expected)* client receives error   | *(expected)* client receives error   |
| `@Blocking`                                  | *(expected)* client receives error   | *(unexpected)* client hangs          |
| `@RunOnVirtualThread`                        | *(expected)* client receives error   | *(unexpected)* client hangs          |


### Expected behavior

Client should receive an error response

### Actual behavior

Client hangs

### How to Reproduce?

1. Clone repo - https://github.com/ranjanashish/quarkus-grpc-unhandled-exception-bug
2. Run unit tests using `./gradlew test`
3. Test will hang
4. Kill test and remove `@Blocking` from the RPC method
5. Re-run unit tests
6. Test will pass

The same behaviour applies when using `@RunOnVirtualThread`.

### Output of `uname -a` or `ver`

Darwin Kernel Version 23.4.0

### Output of `java -version`

openjdk version "21.0.2" 2024-01-16

### Quarkus version or git rev

3.8.3

### Build tool (ie. output of `mvnw --version` or `gradlew --version`)

Gradle 8.5

### Additional information

_No response_
